column1: I do not presume that all people over three score years of age are so entirely ignorant as I am
column2: but probably there are some. I have lived more than sixty years almost in the woods
column4: and never heard any other person speak of
column7: and maturing of the water maple. I have a beautiful low of water maple shade trees along the street in front of my house. In March
column9: I observed that they were in bloom
column10: and many bees were swarming about them. After the bees left them I noticed the seed (specimens enclosed of this spring's growth) in millions. As the leaves put out in April the little knife blade seeds fell off
column11: so thick as to almost cover the ground. My grandson picked up three or four hat-fulls
column12: and I sent the seed to my farm and had them drilled in like wheat
